DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Normal Adjacent Tissue Barcode Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sequence of characters that specifically identifies a particular normal adjacent tissue specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._Next to or adjoining._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:Next to or adjoining.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
